title: Do you think we could ever get an Icathia update?

replies.body:
The biggest lore question I want answered is why Zilean still has his pointy ears.

In the old lore, humans with pointy ears were humans with exceptional magical potential. This is why Janna also had pointy ears.

But Janna is a wind spirit now so I do not know if Riot is going to keep this or if they'll change it.

Perhaps Elves lived in Icathia as well?
Magic powers are part of the logic of the setting. Pointy ears when everyone else doesn’t have them is weird, yes.

> 
> Dude can TRAVEL THROUGH TIME, but the pointy ears are what keep you awake at night?

yes

1. Yes, it does bother us. Magic is an established part of the LoL universe, but elves are not.
2. That Time Travel thing is exactly what we want in his lore. His blurb says he can travel through time, but his biography says he can't. The guy only has two bits of story, but they're in conflict with each other.

His long bio is going to be updated.

We've been pretty clear since last November - wherever there is DIRECT contradiction between the short bio and the long, assume the short is correct until we get to an update.

Also, pointy ears =/= elves. He might be a Vulcan.

(He's not a Vulcan.)

>
> Or they'll maybe retcon Zilean into a spirit. Or a mage king highly attuned to spirits or something

I would be so sad if they retconned him into a spirit (plus, it makes no sense given he uses technology like time bombs).

If he was supposed to be a Mage King, that means he's supposed to:

1. Come before Axamuk (who's stated to be the last Mage King of Icathia before the Shuriman subjugation), yet still be replaced by him without being dead.

2. Survive for thousands of years (although, given his mastery of time magic, this might not be that hard. He's already stated to be immortal in current lore).

3. Survive the invasion of the Void.

Plus, being attuned to spirits sounds more like something a shaman ( {{champion:77}} ) or a mystical warrior ( {{champion:98}} ) would be, not Mage royalty.

In truth, a new Mage King appeared when Icathia rebeled:
> But the Kohari are reborn, rising to serve **the new Mage King** and reclaim their honor.

And well...Zilean already is a Icathian who survived the invasion of the Void.
I'm not trying to reinforce the "attuned to spirirts" theory but Zilean being a Mage King is pretty possible in my opinion.

> [{quoted}](name=Atgo,realm=EUW,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=OzwKbsU6,comment-id=0001000000000000,timestamp=2018-10-19T11:19:16.532+0000)

> 
> And well...Zilean already is a Icathian who survived the invasion of the Void.
> I'm not trying to reinforce the "attuned to spirirts" theory but Zilean being a Mage King is pretty possible in my opinion.

Zilean isn't a king. That's part of what makes him special. He's just a wizard who has spent his life studying this magic and technology, and then when it all goes to hell, he tried to cast the ultimate spell, which ended up displacing him in time, akin to the TARDIS if it never stopped anywhere for more than 10 minutes. 
Making Zilean a king and giving him governmental power of ANY sort ruins what we know of him as a character. I'm not saying he's the most developed at this time, but making him a king would be an entirely too dramatic shift of character and personality, because there's a degree of charisma and confidence that Zilean simply doesn't exhibit. It would be like if instead of reworking Irelia into being a blade dancer, they suddenly reworked her into a timid priestess under Karma's guidance.
I am just firmly against this Mage King option because it tears Zilean into a direction that simply does not fit who he is.

2. That would mean he has switched factions in the lore a total of three times. First Urtistan, then Icathia and now Targon. All of Riot's work of implementing him as a survivor of Icathia would have been for nothing.

3. How would you explain him wielding technology like Time Bombs? Targon doesn't seem like the most technologically advanced nation (Level of Technology is stated to be Low on the official Map of Runeterra).

It's rare for a VGU to completely change the faction of someone, especially someone that's already changed faction in the past once before.

Check all the VGU's from recent times:

Ezreal stayed a Piltovan, Nunu stayed a Freljordian, Akali and Irelia stayed Ionians, Swain and Urgot stayed Noxians, Galio stayed a Demacian construct, Warwick stayed a Zaunite etc. etc.

Riot wouldn't introduce Zilean as a survivor of Icathia, only to throw it away like it was nothing.

> 
>  I mean I'm really not trying to argue too hard for my Aspect suggestion, as to sufficiently pitch that opinion would take a thread of it's own rather than a simple comment.

I'd love to see a fully fledged thread on this if it means you'll answer my questions.

Zilean's ties to Icathia is at this point slim, sure its the current interpretation but its still superficial without establishing hard canon first, especially since those details are based around his current in-game identity. Like Evelynn's placeholder story before her rework, had maintained and then evolved a lot of her older identity eventually. So you could take things with a grain of salt, especially before the champ's rework or official lore is released.

If it's your opinion that exploring (optional) new directions for Zilean is out of the question, then that is fine, and it would be difficult to convince someone whose made up their mind already. But denying to yourself that theoretical opportunity over the tiniest lore, that could be changed regardless if you think it should be maintained instead, isn't the most convincing counter argument.

Again, regardless of personal opinions, my initial comment was in nature an arbitrary thought. You could like it or not, it doesn't matter once Zilean gets updated.

Honestly, Zilean would be fine with a pure visual update.

His abilities are hella cool, but I do think the clockwork visuals on his Q and autos are out of place.

The clock visuals are fine when they're represented as energy, but I think the physical clocks/bombs/gears would be fine to get rid of.

Zilean could also use a gameplay update.
His Q is his only source of damage,which means that it is pretty powerful early on,but feels rather weak later in the game,his W and E are simply unimpressive and boring skills and his ult causes some contradictory gameplay that can lead to confusion(if you wanna live you have to die).

Having only one damage source is fine for Zilean, since his W makes it effectively two damage sources.
You could achieve a similar effeect by simply having his Q and E work on a charge system, but if you do that he loses his main "time mage" aspect.

His E is fun as hell to use, but it's not necessarily the healthiest spell.
Chained 99% slows are too powerful, while chained hastes make certain champions far too powerful.

His ult is strong and interesting, and I don't really see anything "wrong" with it per se.
Conceptually speaking, there are definitely spells that **could** fill the design space of a "time based control mage ultimate" much better than the live Chronoshift, but the techinical hurdles they'd have to jump over are significant for something that would be good enough to be worth replacing the current ult.

Even with the W I feel like his damage scaling is a bit off,not to mention that it also creates a visual dissonance between Zileans design and his abilities(would you imagine Zilean floating around in the lore,throwing bombs around like a madman?).

E is like you said yourself a bit problematic.

And you are right that his current ult is pretty cool,but I do think that it could be altered(not fully replaced) to work a bit smoothly.
I mean having to suddenly turn around and run into the enemy,hoping that they'll kill you fast enough will likely always feel awkward for you and your enemies.

Overall I don't think that Zileans kit is an extreme mess,but I do believe that it is rather clunky and could use some updates on his W,E and R(and if his W is changed then he also needs changes to his Q).
Throwing bombs/clocks/gears doesn't make sense, but the bombs could easily be reskinned into "unstable time seals" with the same mechanics but different visuals.

Even then I feel like it'd be odd to see Zilean spam spells like that.
It just clashes with him being this old looking.

Anyway i still think that the skills could use some finetuning,though I don't think that he needs a complete overhaul like Galio or Sion.Maybe something similar to Nunu,who basically kept most of his spells in altered forms(even if 1 of them was moved to his passive).

A Zilean VGU where he is revealed to be a Mage-King of Icathia that did his part to weaponize the Void in the fight against Shurima only to later regret it and master Time Magic just to live long enough to undo his wrongs is weirdly compelling.
